11A) Behavioral Snapshot.Signal: Asks for proof and specifics before deciding; prefers written confirmation and simple models
Coaching moves that work: Share lender emails, SOP cites, and screenshots when rules matter
Provide one-page models showing DSCR, working capital, and fee treatment
End calls with written recap and next steps he can share with Nidhi
Watch-outs: Vague assurances or verbal-only answers stall him
Too many documents without a summary slows him down

2025-06-25: Asked for lender proof that fees can be included in project costs; said "That actually makes me way more comfortable... I'm set" after seeing email
2025-11-25: "Please send over to Bruce... once he gives an email saying they're good to lend based on the terms, I will send to Johnny to review and sign"
2026-01-13: Followed up for billing reports and fee schedules on ABA; said he would brief Wendy (Live Oak) with facts and either restructure or walk

11A) Behavioral Snapshot.Signal: Applies "needs vs wants" filter and passes quickly on misfit or shrinking markets
Coaching moves that work: Lead with why the business is a "need" with recurring or mandated replacement cycles
Call out market trends, DSCR, concentration, and CRE impact upfront
Offer clear "why pursue" and "why pass" in two to three lines
Watch-outs: May skip sticky B2C that behaves like a need; show churn and repeat data to keep it in play
Recent examples: 2025-06-09: Passed on evaporative cooling parts - "It's a shrinking market... outdated product"
2025-09-17: On framing/carpentry deal - "It is very risky to be exposed to new construction... I don't want to tie my personal guarantee to it"
2025-11-04: Passed on car-titles e-commerce - "at the mercy of the Google search algorithm... I don't want to get into that anxiety"

11A) Behavioral Snapshot.Signal: Sets firm time boundaries; mornings are flexible, evenings are family time
Coaching moves that work: Book working sessions in morning AZ time
Use Slack or email for concise follow-ups; avoid evening asks
Batch decisions into early blocks when he has focus
Watch-outs: Late-night or vague "urgent" requests cause friction and slow response

2025-08-05: Described routine of dinner at 6 pm and early bedtime
2026-01-06: Employer forced open calendar visibility; blocked "lunch" window to keep meeting details private

11A) Behavioral Snapshot.Signal: Coachable and open to structured guidance; asks for step-by-step help
Coaching moves that work: Give checklists, timelines, and simple playbook for LOIs and diligence gates
Calibrate with live deals; let him test and refine in real time
If conversation drifts, ask to reset and confirm agenda
Watch-outs: Too many options at once dilutes focus; present 2-3 choices with a recommendation

11A) Behavioral Snapshot.Signal: Momentum dips after setbacks; peers and clear weekly targets help him keep going
Coaching moves that work: Set weekly pipeline rhythm: NDAs, CIMs, broker calls, and next steps
Celebrate small wins and keep top-of-funnel full while deep-diving
Encourage use of Buyers Club and peer touchpoints
Watch-outs: Long gaps without visible progress lead to energy drops and slower outreach

11A) Behavioral Snapshot.Signal: Decides and moves fast once comfortable; locks in payments and next steps on the call
Coaching moves that work: When ready, confirm dates, dollar amounts, and owners
Send agreement and invoice immediately; set calendar holds before ending call
Watch-outs: Only push to commit after he has the proof and model he asked for

11A) Behavioral Snapshot.Signal: Accepts realistic timelines and wants focus defined early
Coaching moves that work: Set expectations on 12-month search; show early milestones
In first 90 days, co-define "what we are and are not going after"
Watch-outs: Vague or shifting criteria frustrates him; lock the box and iterate with live deals

11A) Behavioral Snapshot.Signal: Local-first and practical about lender fit

Use lenders who accept fee inclusion with clear DSCR; share written guidance
Flag relocation and housing logistics early if out-of-state deal appears

11A) Behavioral Snapshot.Signal: Runs playbook for learning, even when deal isn't ideal

Time-box effort and set clear go/no-go gates to avoid over-investing
Offer quick Slack feedback on his question list before calls

11A) Behavioral Snapshot.Signal: Wants seller call before any LOI; rejects "spray and pray" LOIs
Coaching moves that work: Secure seller intro before discussing LOI terms
Keep him LOI-ready with template and plan for quick legal review
Use pre-qual letter to handle broker "can you fund it?" questions
Watch-outs: Brokers who gatekeep company name or push for LOI first
Pressure to set working capital number early

11A) Behavioral Snapshot.Signal: Leads with downside protection; wants performance-protected, SBA-compliant structures
Coaching moves that work: Show simple example of forgivable seller note tied to revenue or backlog
Tie offers to last year's revenue or awarded projects
Model worst/no-change/best cases and remove balloons that hurt DSCR
Watch-outs: Brokers pushing high cash at close or earnout language
Complex terms without plain-English summary can confuse seller

11A) Behavioral Snapshot.Signal: Time-boxes indecision; pushes for deadlines and uses takeaway closes
Coaching moves that work: Propose clear decision dates and next steps
If delays persist, use polite "we need to withdraw by X date" note
Offer fast paths (meet in person, lender call) to unblock decisions

11A) Behavioral Snapshot.Signal: Uses AI to speed early diligence and reduce cost in short windows
Coaching moves that work: Send CSV exports of bank statements, GL detail, AR/AP aging, and billing reports
Give a clear question list (cash-to-books checks, working capital peg, addback flags)
Sanity-check AI findings with a few manual tie-outs and plan QoE after lender interest
Watch-outs: Do not over-rely on AI outputs without sampling source docs
Keep summaries simple for sellers and lenders; avoid technical jargon
Recent examples: 2026-01-13: Said he will run a "QoE-lite" using LLMs to reconcile cash to books and set a working capital peg within the MSP's 25-day window before paying for QoE

11A) Behavioral Snapshot.Signal: Researches broker background and uses it to steer process
Coaching moves that work: Quietly check broker's other listings and deal sizes to calibrate expectations
Arm him with scripts to explain why larger deals need a normal sequence
Keep tone calm and facts-based to avoid escalation
Watch-outs: Do not confront the broker in a way that risks access to the seller
Share findings with the seller only when needed and tactfully
